name: SKPhysicsWorld
desc: The driver of the physics engine in a scene; it exposes the ability for you to configure and query the physics system.

items.name: var gravity: CGVector
items.desc: A vector that specifies the gravitational acceleration applied to physics bodies in the physics world.

items.name: var speed: CGFloat
items.desc: The rate at which the simulation executes.

items.name: func add(SKPhysicsJoint)
items.desc: Adds a joint to the physics world.

items.name: func removeAllJoints()
items.desc: Removes all joints from the physics world.

items.name: func remove(SKPhysicsJoint)
items.desc: Removes a specific joint from the physics world.

items.name: var contactDelegate: SKPhysicsContactDelegate?
items.desc: A delegate that is called when two physics bodies come in contact with each other.

items.name: func body(alongRayStart: CGPoint, end: CGPoint) -> SKPhysicsBody?
items.desc: Searches for the first physics body that intersects a ray.

items.name: func body(at: CGPoint) -> SKPhysicsBody?
items.desc: Searches for the first physics body that contains a point.

items.name: func body(in: CGRect) -> SKPhysicsBody?
items.desc: Searches for the first physics body that intersects the specified rectangle.

items.name: func enumerateBodies(alongRayStart: CGPoint, end: CGPoint, using: (SKPhysicsBody, CGPoint, CGVector, UnsafeMutablePointer<ObjCBool>) -> Void)
items.desc: Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that intersect a ray.

items.name: func enumerateBodies(at: CGPoint, using: (SKPhysicsBody, UnsafeMutablePointer<ObjCBool>) -> Void)
items.desc: Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that contain a point.

items.name: func enumerateBodies(in: CGRect, using: (SKPhysicsBody, UnsafeMutablePointer<ObjCBool>) -> Void)
items.desc: Enumerates all the physics bodies in the scene that intersect the specified rectangle.

items.name: func sampleFields(at: vector_float3) -> vector_float3
items.desc: Samples all of the field nodes in the scene and returns the summation of their forces at that point.
